skill.author: BarisSozen

security_audit.summary: This skill consists solely of documentation and prompt guidance for performing code reviews. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem operations are defined. The skill describes using git commands for change detection, which is expected behavior for a code review tool.

content.value_statement: Manual code reviews miss issues that automated checks catch. This skill orchestrates security, type safety, DeFi, and performance checks across all changed files to catch problems before they reach production.
actual_capabilities: Identifies changed files using git diff and git status commands
Maps relevant review skills to file types and patterns
Runs security, DeFi, type safety, and performance checklists
Generates structured reports with severity levels
Offers auto-fix suggestions for critical issues
limitations: Does not modify code automatically without user approval
Cannot access repositories without git initialized
Cannot review code in binary or compiled files
Does not execute test suites or build processes

use_cases.title: Pre-commit validation
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive review before committing to catch issues early and maintain code quality standards.

use_cases.title: Security-focused audits
use_cases.description: Apply security checklists to identify SQL injection, XSS, and command injection vulnerabilities.

use_cases.title: DeFi protocol reviews
use_cases.description: Check token decimals, slippage protection, BigInt handling, and RPC error handling in smart contract code.

prompt_templates.title: Full review
prompt_templates.prompt: Run full-review skill to check all changes for security issues, type safety, DeFi correctness, and performance problems.

prompt_templates.title: Security focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the latest changes with security checklist focus. Check for SQL injection, XSS, hardcoded secrets, and command injection.

prompt_templates.title: Quick check
prompt_templates.prompt: Do a quick review of changed files. Flag only critical issues that must be fixed before commit.

prompt_templates.title: Type safety
prompt_templates.prompt: Check type safety across TypeScript, Rust, and PostgreSQL boundaries. Look for 'as any' assertions and type mismatches.

best_practices: Run full-review before every commit to catch issues early and reduce review cycles
Address critical issues immediately as they represent security or correctness risks
Use the generated report as a checklist and re-run review after fixes
anti_patterns: Skipping review when changes seem small - subtle bugs often hide in minor changes
Ignoring warnings - they indicate technical debt that compounds over time
Committing without re-running review after applying auto-fixes

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Trigger phrases like 'review code' or 'full review' activate it.

faq.question: What is the performance impact?
faq.answer: Review time scales with changed files. Simple changes take seconds; complex PRs may take a few minutes.

faq.question: How does it integrate with git?
faq.answer: Uses git diff and git status to detect changes. Works with any git-based repository without additional setup.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All analysis happens locally. No code is sent to external services. Only reads your repository files.

faq.question: What if review fails or times out?
faq.answer: Try reviewing fewer files by specifying paths. Ensure git status is clean. Restart with /quick-review for faster results.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters check style and syntax. This skill reviews logic, security patterns, type correctness, and domain-specific issues like DeFi calculations.
